newsitem.title: INDIA: India gold closes steady, silver up on world trend.
newsitem.headline: India gold closes steady, silver up on world trend.

text.p: Gold 24 carat closed steady at 4,520 rupees per 10 gramme amid limited arrivals during the day while physical demand remained low despite approaching festivals, dealers said on Thursday.
"Panic remained continued among the traders after recent raids by income-tax officials which in turn led to low volume of business," one broker said.
Prices of a gold biscuit (116.64 gramme) closed steady at 52,900 rupees per piece after gaining 300 rupees on Wednesday.
Gold prices consolidated recent gains on expectation of higher festival demand in the coming days, but sentiment at the close was subdued following reports of a slide in the world market.

Silver (.999) closed 30 rupees higher at 6,445 rupees per kg against the previous close of 6,415 rupees but down five rupees against the opening level of 6,450 rupees as light profit-taking trimmed some of the early gains towards the close.
"Silver prices opened higher amid shortage of ready stock and the rally in the world market but later on came down on profit-taking," dealer said.
Silver was up by 65 rupees per kg on Wednesday.
The Bombay bullion market will be closed on Friday for Independence Day and on Monday for a Hindu religious festival.
